description:
In Tuesday night's international friendlies - Cape Verde provided the results of the night a 2-0 victory over Portugal. The goals coming from Fortes and Gege. It was the first time the island nation has beaten Portugal, who were without Cristiano Ronaldo and had Andre Pinto sent off with half an hour still to go.

In Turin, Italy and England drew 1-1. Graziano Pellè opened the scoring for the host before Andros Townsend equalised after coming on as a second-half substitute. The BBC's football correspondent John Murray was watching.

The question was, would this match give us a true gauge of how much progress England have really made since the World Cup. In the first half, it looked like not much as Roy Hodgson's experiment with Phil Jones as a holding midfielder and Rooney behind Kane-Walcott didn't work. But Hodgson changed system and personnel, and in the second half, it was significantly better. However, England will need, and in the next year, against France, Spain and Germany, will get more tests like this, that will provide a true idea of that development.

Well after the match, the England captain Wayne Rooney was full of praise for the impact that Townsend had on the game.
